notesStmt.note: Benyamin ben Shemu᾿el of Ancona: inscribed in the colophon, folio 251r. Fra Mar. (Mon.?) Aurelio (-ius?): inscribed, folio 251r, with a date of 30 April 1634. A record of sale in Italian, pasted on the first flyleaf, [i recto], with a date of 25 April 1721. Folio 252 is a paper leaf, containing a homiletical note in Italian and a piece in Hebrew. Approximately 17th century.
Manuscript description based on Margoliouth, G.: Catalogue of the Hebrew and Samaritan Manuscripts in the British Museum, London 1965.

msContents.summary: Sefer Malmad ha-talmidim, an ethico-philosophical discourse on the passages of the Pentateuch in the order of weekly pericopes by Jacob ben Abba Mari ben Samson Anatoli.

msItem.title: Sefer Malmad ha-talmidim ספר מלמד התלמידים

collation.p: 25 quires: i11 (folios 2-12), ii-xxiv10 (folios 13-242), xxv9 (243-251). Quires signed at the beginning and at the end with Hebrew letters.

scriptDesc.scriptNote: Italian (or Byzantine?) semi-cursive script of 15th century. Ḥayim ben Mikha᾿el: inscribed on folio 251r. His name occasionally marked off in the margin and in the middle of the line, e.g. folios 43v, 76r, 163r.
